info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 13 at 5:55PM CDT until June 13 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN PANOLA AND CENTRAL RUSK COUNTIES... At 555 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Henderson, moving east at 40 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR HENDERSON. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Baseball size hail was just reported at Henderson High School in Henderson with this storm. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Henderson, Carthage, Pinehill, Gary City, Chapman, Dotson, Woods, Church Hill and Fairplay. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
